item.title: Trump's tariffs were 'last straw' for this business owner's now-shuttered store
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Jennifer Bergman, who says she had to close her family's toy store business of 44 years in July 2025 due to President Trump's tariffs.

item.description: The Supreme Court ruled Friday that President Trump overstepped his authority in ordering tariffs on nearly everything the U.S. imports. Here's some economic context to understand that decision.

item.title: The economy slowed in the last 3 months of the year — but was still solid in 2025
item.description: The U.S. economy grew 2.2% in 2025, a modest slowdown from 2.4% the previous year. GDP gains were fueled by solid consumer spending and business investment.

item.title: Using saliva to detect disease holds promise, but it's not perfected yet
item.description: Easier than a blood test, saliva tests have the potential to detect cavities, infections and even cancer. But a lack of insurance coverage and other obstacles stand in the way of wider use.

item.title: An expected end-of-year federal ban puts hemp businesses in jeopardy
item.description: A federal ban on most hemp-derived THC products is expected to go into effect towards the end of 2026. That could put the kibosh on the most profitable market for hemp farmers.
